name: Bulbasaur
hints: Quadrupedal creature with a bulb on its back
Its body is a combination of blue and green tones
Has red eyes and pointed, cat-like ears
The bulb on its back looks like a large seed or plant
Its skin is dotted with darker green spots
Short, stubby legs with small, clawed toes
Plant Pokémon with a Grass/Poison typing
The bulb grows as it gains experience and evolves
One of the starter Pokémon from Kanto region
First entry in the Pokédex

name: Ivysaur
hints: The bulb on its back has grown into a flower bud
Blue-green skin similar to Bulbasaur, but darker
Its legs are more muscular compared to its pre-evolution
Small tusks are visible on the corners of its mouth
Sharp, pointed leaves surround the bud on its back
It walks on all fours but appears more robust and aggressive
The bud is on the verge of blooming into a large flower
Eyes remain red with a piercing gaze
Known for its Grass/Poison type attacks
Intermediate evolution in the Bulbasaur line

name: Venusaur
hints: Massive Pokémon with a full blooming flower on its back
Flower resembles a palm tree with large leaves
Its skin is a darker shade of blue-green with spots
Broad, flat body with heavy legs and claws
The flower on its back is a vibrant red with white spots
Petals are surrounded by a crown of broad green leaves
Two long, sharp teeth are visible on its lower jaw
Known for its ability to manipulate sunlight
Final evolution of Bulbasaur
Its weight and flower give it a sluggish appearance

name: Charmander
hints: Small, bipedal lizard with an orange body
A flame burns at the tip of its tail
Has a yellow underbelly and light blue eyes
Its hands and feet are small with clawed digits
Known for its cheerful yet determined expression
The flame on its tail represents its life force
As it evolves, the flame grows larger
It is often seen looking up at its trainer with loyalty
Its fire-based moves become more powerful as it grows
Starter Pokémon from the Kanto region

name: Charmeleon
hints: Orange, bipedal lizard with a more aggressive appearance
Its flame is larger and more intense than Charmander's
Its eyes are sharper, and it has a more battle-ready stance
A single horn protrudes from the back of its head
Its claws are larger and more prominent
The flame on its tail is noticeably hotter
Its body is more muscular, indicating its strength
It can be seen as a bridge between its two other forms
Known for its fiery temper
Intermediate evolution in the Charmander line

name: Charizard
hints: Large, dragon-like Pokémon with orange scales
Blue, bat-like wings sprout from its back
The flame on its tail is massive and burns intensely
Its mouth is lined with sharp teeth, hinting at its power
Its wingspan allows it to soar through the skies
Its eyes are fierce, reflecting its strong will
Two horn-like structures are visible on its head
Despite its dragon-like appearance, it is not a Dragon-type
Known for its destructive fire-based moves
Final evolution of Charmander

name: Squirtle
hints: Small, turtle-like Pokémon with a blue body
A brown shell with a light-yellow underbelly
Large, innocent eyes and small ears on the side of its head
Its limbs are short but end in sharp claws
Known for its ability to shoot water from its mouth
Has a cute, yet determined expression
The tail is curled, resembling a wave or whirlpool
Its shell is tough, offering it protection in battles
Starter Water-type Pokémon from Kanto
The shell grows sturdier as it evolves

name: Wartortle
hints: Turtle Pokémon with blue skin and larger, stronger limbs
Its tail is long and fluffy, resembling ocean waves
Ears are larger and more pointed compared to Squirtle
Its shell has become darker and more rugged
It has a more serious expression, indicating maturity
The tail helps it swim faster and with more agility
Its body is muscular, indicating its increased power
The shell provides added defense in battles
Intermediate evolution in the Squirtle line
Its ears and tail are a signature feature of its design

name: Blastoise
hints: Large, turtle-like Pokémon with water cannons on its back
Its shell is massive and extremely durable
The cannons are capable of shooting water at high pressure
Its blue body is thick and muscular, indicating its power
Short tail and large, clawed feet for stability
Its eyes are small but fierce, showing its battle readiness
The cannons retract into its shell when not in use
Known for its Water-type moves, especially Hydro Pump
Final evolution of Squirtle
Its cannons are its most distinct and powerful feature

name: Caterpie
hints: Small, green caterpillar Pokémon with large, innocent eyes
A red, antenna-like structure on its head
Yellow, segmented body with suction-like feet
Small and defenseless but can evolve quickly
Its skin is smooth, and it moves slowly
The antenna is used to scare off predators
Known for its rapid growth and evolution
One of the weakest Pokémon in battle
A pure Bug-type Pokémon
Early-game Pokémon commonly found in forests

name: Metapod
hints: Green, cocoon-like Pokémon with a hard shell
Its eyes are barely visible through small slits
It is completely immobile except for slight movements
The shell protects its vulnerable body during metamorphosis
Its body is bent, resembling a crescent or leaf
Known for its high defense but lack of offensive moves
A defensive evolution from Caterpie
It evolves quickly into a much more capable form
One of the most immobile Pokémon in existence
It is often found hanging in trees or bushes

name: Butterfree
hints: Butterfly Pokémon with large, white wings
Purple body with big red eyes
Wings have black patterns and are fragile-looking
It uses its wings to scatter sleep-inducing powders
Has two thin antennae on its head
It can fly swiftly and gracefully through the air
The transformation from Metapod to Butterfree is significant
Its wings allow it to fly at high altitudes
Known for its Bug/Flying typing
Final evolution of Caterpie

name: Weedle
hints: Small, worm-like Pokémon with a yellow body
It has a sharp, conical stinger on its head
Its body is segmented with small, pinkish legs
A second stinger is found at the end of its tail
Its head has a pink, round nose that stands out
Its defense lies in its ability to poison enemies
Its body is narrow and flexible, allowing it to move easily
Known for quickly evolving into a cocoon-like state
A pure Bug/Poison type Pokémon
Commonly found in forests or grassy areas

name: Kakuna
hints: Cocoon Pokémon with a yellow, hard outer shell
Its body is completely immobile, but its eyes show vigilance
Has a smooth, armored shell that offers strong defense
It is completely vulnerable in this stage of evolution
The outer shell is shaped like an angular teardrop
Despite its immobility, it's ready to evolve at any moment
The stingers from its previous form are still faintly visible
It relies on its hard shell for protection from predators
Evolves quickly into a more dangerous form
Bug/Poison type like its earlier stage

name: Beedrill
hints: Large insect Pokémon with three sharp stingers
Its body is segmented with yellow and black stripes
It has two long stingers for arms and one at the end of its abdomen
Its wings are small, allowing it to fly at high speeds
It has red, aggressive-looking eyes
Known for its poisonous, needle-like attacks
Its thin waist connects its upper body to its abdomen
It is extremely territorial and aggressive in battle
Bug/Poison type, known for its signature move Twinneedle
Final evolution of Weedle

name: Pidgey
hints: Small bird Pokémon with a beige and brown feathered body
It has a light cream-colored underbelly
Its wings are broad, though its size is compact
Has a small beak and sharp black eyes
Its tail feathers are short but fan out slightly
Its legs are thin but equipped with sharp talons
Known for being docile and often fleeing from battle
Frequently seen flapping its wings to stir up dust
Normal/Flying type, commonly found in open fields
One of the most common early-game Pokémon

name: Pidgeotto
hints: Larger bird Pokémon with red-tipped wings and tail feathers
Has a prominent crest of red feathers on its head
Its beak and talons are sharp, used for hunting prey
Its body is more muscular and streamlined for flying
The feathers around its neck are cream-colored
Eyes are sharp, indicating its keen vision and precision
Known for patrolling its territory in search of prey
Its wings are broad, allowing for swift flight
Intermediate evolution in the Pidgey line
Normal/Flying type, known for its speed

name: Pidgeot
hints: Large bird Pokémon with majestic red and yellow plumage
Its crest of feathers extends long past its head
Its wings are powerful, designed for long flights and high speeds
Beak and talons are sharp, showing its predator nature
The feathers on its back are brown with cream-colored underbelly
Tail feathers are red with a pattern of sharp stripes
Eyes are sharp, giving it a fierce and intimidating appearance
Known for creating powerful gusts of wind with its wings
Final evolution of Pidgey, a symbol of strength and grace
Normal/Flying type, used by experienced trainers

name: Rattata
hints: Small, purple rodent Pokémon with large front teeth
Its body is sleek, with short limbs and a long, thin tail
It has prominent, whisker-like facial hair on each side
Its sharp teeth grow constantly, making it a powerful biter
Has a curled tail and pointed ears with cream-colored inside
It is known for being extremely territorial and aggressive
The underside of its body is cream-colored
Known for its speed and tendency to scavenge for food
Normal type, commonly found in urban areas
Has an eager, alert expression, ready for action

name: Raticate
hints: Large, brown rodent Pokémon with massive front teeth
Its body is more robust and muscular than Rattata
Whiskers are long and bristle-like, flaring outward from its face
Its large incisors are sharp and continuously growing
Tail is long, thick, and scaly
Its ears are pointed and more pronounced
Known for its ferocity and quick temper
It stands on two legs, with powerful hind legs for jumping
Normal type, commonly seen in battle for its biting attacks
Final evolution of Rattata

name: Spearow
hints: Small bird Pokémon with brown feathers and a fierce expression
Its wings are short and pointed, but it flies swiftly
Beak is small but sharp, ideal for pecking
Tail feathers are short but sharply fanned out
Its eyes are aggressive and narrow, reflecting its temper
It has talons that help it grip onto branches or prey
Known for being much more aggressive than Pidgey
Often attacks in flocks when provoked
Normal/Flying type, known for its loud cry
One of the first bird Pokémon encountered early in the games

name: Fearow
hints: Large bird Pokémon with a long neck and sharp beak
Its wings are broad and designed for long-distance flight
The plumage on its body is mostly brown with a lighter underbelly
Has a large, spear-like beak that it uses to pierce its prey
Its eyes are sharp and vigilant, suited for high-altitude flight
Tail feathers are long and fan out like a sharp blade
The crest on its head gives it a regal appearance
It flies at great heights, scanning for targets below
Known for its Normal/Flying typing and speed
Final evolution of Spearow

name: Ekans
hints: Snake Pokémon with a purple, coiled body
Its body is segmented with pale yellow bands
It has narrow, predatory eyes and a flicking tongue
Known for its silent, slithering movements
Its long, flexible body helps it squeeze its prey
The underside of its body is a lighter shade than the top
Has a small, pointed head with fangs for injecting poison
It often hides in tall grass to ambush prey
Poison-type Pokémon known for its constricting abilities
Its name is 'snake' spelled backward

name: Arbok
hints: Cobra Pokémon with a menacing hood pattern
Its body is long and muscular, designed for squeezing prey
Has an intimidating hood with a face-like pattern
The pattern on its hood changes depending on the region
It has piercing red eyes and sharp fangs for delivering venom
Its body is mainly purple, with the underside being lighter
Known for its ability to paralyze prey with a glance
Slithers silently but can strike quickly when provoked
Poison-type Pokémon, feared for its strength
Final evolution of Ekans

name: Pikachu
hints: Yellow rodent Pokémon with red electric sacs on its cheeks
Its long ears have black tips
It has a lightning bolt-shaped tail
Its fur is sleek and designed to store electricity
Known for its playful and curious demeanor
Can generate electric attacks from its cheeks
Its small size and agile movements make it hard to catch
Loves to eat berries and prefers living near forests
Electric-type Pokémon known for its Thunderbolt move
Evolves from Pichu and evolves into Raichu
